content.question: Each person in a group of twenty people at a hotel orders one meal chosen from oatmeal, eggs, or pancakes and one hot beverage chosen from coffee or tea. One person will be selected at random from the twenty people. What is the sample space for the meal and beverage for the person selected?

choices.label: {(oatmeal, coffee), (oatmeal, tea), (eggs, coffee), (eggs, tea), (pancakes, coffee), (pancakes, tea)}
{(coffee, tea, oatmeal), (coffee, tea, eggs), (coffee, tea, pancakes)}

content.answer: {(oatmeal, coffee), (oatmeal, tea), (eggs, coffee), (eggs, tea), (pancakes, coffee), (pancakes, tea)}

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
